result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Glass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intoxicants in M/V. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L Glass

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:05 a.m.
Attorney Cristian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant James L Glass in court.  
State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance of Intoxicant in Motor Vehicle, Statute 13-102(c)(2).
Defendant has no objections.  Court grants the amendment.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid in 60-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

1:58 PM  Defendant James L Glass in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.

Defendant wishes to contest this case.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for further proceedings and status of counsel.  
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

1:43 PM Defendant James L Glass in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
